instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.SMC_FAN_0_CTL: What is SMC_FAN_0_CTL? SMC_FAN_0_CTL is a line between the SMC and the fan that controls fan speed that is frequently disturbed when someone inexperienced knocks resistors in the area off with their fingernail or screwdriver when unplugging the fan. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin after it gets hot
threads.message:
Board had some corrosion around <RESISTOR>R5117</RESISTOR> near the SMC, fixed that but the original problem of the computer restarting still there, I have boiled it down to the fan not working.

Already replaced SMC, clean BIOS, <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR>

<RESISTOR>R6060</RESISTOR>/61/65 all ok

SMC bypass also no fan spin

Shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> to ground also no fan spin

New fan also no fan spin

At fan connector I have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5V, <SIGNAL>FAN_RT_TACH</SIGNAL> 3.3V 

Please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin after it gets hot
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground readings on <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> pins with good board.

Also compare voltages; do that in SMC bypass, when fan should spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Fan Spin after it gets hot
threads.message: Thanks the problem was one or more of the components mentioned before AND the fan.
